commands.title: abc: MIDI Input: Start MIDI input
commands.description: Start MIDI Input. You can also use the `Start MIDI Input` button on the right of the status bar. MIDI input device is set using `abc: MIDI Playback: Set input device` command.`

commands.title: abc: MIDI Input: Stop MIDI input
commands.description: Stop MIDI Input. You can also use the `Stop MIDI Input` button on the right of the status bar.

commands.title: abc: MIDI Input: Set input device
commands.description: Set workspace-folder specific MIDI input device for input. You can also change this manually (for more scopes) in settings under `abc â€º Midi Input: Input`.

commands.title: abc: MIDI Input: Restart MIDI Input
commands.description: Restart MIDI Input. Try this if the input stops working after changing your MIDI Input device/port.

abc.midiInput.input.description: MIDI Device used for input. If none specified, the first valid device is used. After changing, please run the `abc: MIDI Input: Restart MIDI Input` command. You can alternatively use the command `abc: MIDI Input: Set output device` to select a device from a list.

abc.midiInput.chordMode.description: Chord mode in music entry. Registers notes that are pressed and held together as a chord instead of sequential notes.

scripts.pretest: pnpm run compile && pnpm run lint
